Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

-- Baseball bat. No damage, so it can be used for non-violent games. Though the giant baseballs can still kill you -- by knocking you off the stage. -- Code for number-of-baseballs-used GUI modeled on / copied from the one for ClamTrap (Seashell Snare).
local Tool = script.Parent
local SwingAnim local SwingSound
local myCharacter local myHumanoid local myPlayer local LeftArm local RightArm local Torso
local isBaseballisticObj local baseballisticScript
local screenGui local frame local image local text local baseballsRemaining
local Baseball = Instance.new("Part") Baseball.Name = "Baseball" Baseball.formFactor = 3 --Custom Baseball.Size = Vector3.new(0.3, 0.3, 0.3) Baseball.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball Baseball.Material = "Grass" Baseball.Locked = true
local BaseballMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") BaseballMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=55021861" BaseballMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=55021914" BaseballMesh.Parent = Baseball
local BaseballForce = Instance.new("BodyForce") BaseballForce.force = Vector3.new(0, Baseball:GetMass() * 1400, 0) BaseballForce.Name = "Baseball Force"
Tool.Enabled = true
function startSpecial(key) isBaseballisticObj = Tool:FindFirstChild("IsBaseballistic") if isBaseballisticObj then if key:lower() == "x" and Tool.Enabled and not isBaseballisticObj.Value then baseballsRemaining = Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballsRemaining") if baseballsRemaining then baseballisticScript = Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballisticScript") if baseballisticScript ~= nil and baseballsRemaining.Value > 0 then Tool.Enabled = false isBaseballisticObj.Value = true baseballisticScript = baseballisticScript:Clone() baseballisticScript.Name = "NewBaseballisticScript" baseballisticScript.Parent = Tool baseballisticScript.Disabled = false end end end end end
function onActivated() -- A few necessary checks if not Tool.Enabled then return end isBaseballisticObj = Tool:FindFirstChild("IsBaseballistic") myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") LeftArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Left Arm") RightArm = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Right Arm") if not (myHumanoid and Torso and LeftArm and RightArm) then return end
-- Now on to the action. Tool.Enabled = false SwingSound = Tool:FindFirstChild("BatCrack") SwingAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballSwing")) if SwingAnim then SwingAnim:Play() end
local Ball = Baseball:Clone() Ball.Parent = game.Workspace Ball.CanCollide = false
local BallWeld = Instance.new("Weld") BallWeld.Name = "Baseball Weld" BallWeld.Part0 = LeftArm BallWeld.Part1 = Ball BallWeld.C1 = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0, 1, 0)) BallWeld.Parent = game.Workspace
wait (0.7) BallWeld:Remove()
local BallForce = BaseballForce:Clone() BallForce.Parent = Ball wait() BallForce:Remove()
wait(0.27) if SwingSound then SwingSound:Play() end --SwingSound has .13 secs of silence before really getting to the crack sound, wait(0.13) -- so we have to play it early. Ball:Remove()
local ProjectileScript = Tool:FindFirstChild("Projectile Script") if ProjectileScript then ProjectileScript = ProjectileScript:Clone() ProjectileScript.Parent = Tool ProjectileScript.Disabled = false end wait(0.2)
Tool.Enabled = true end
function onEquipped(mouse) if mouse then mouse.KeyDown:connect(startSpecial) end
myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(myCharacter) if not myPlayer then return end
-- Set up GUI displaying number of giant baseballs remaining for use. baseballsRemaining = Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballsRemaining") screenGui = Instance.new("ScreenGui") screenGui.Name = "BaseballsGui" screenGui.Parent = myPlayer.PlayerGui
frame = Instance.new("Frame") frame.Name = "BaseballContainer" frame.Position = UDim2.new(0, 0, 0.75, 0) frame.Size = UDim2.new(0, 75, 0, 75) frame.Parent = screenGui frame.BackgroundTransparency = 1.0
image = Instance.new("ImageLabel") image.Name = "Baseball" image.Image = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=55120856" image.Parent = frame image.Position = UDim2.new(0, 2.5, 0, 2.5) image.Size = UDim2.new(0, 70, 0, 70) image.BackgroundTransparency = 1.0
text = Instance.new("TextLabel") text.Text = baseballsRemaining.Value if baseballsRemaining then baseballsRemaining.Changed:connect(function() text.Text = baseballsRemaining.Value end) end text.Position = UDim2.new(0.75, 0, 0.75, 0) text.Size = UDim2.new(0.5, 0, 0.5, 0) text.Parent = frame text.BackgroundTransparency = 1.0 text.TextColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red") text.FontSize = 7 end
function onUnequipped() if SwingAnim then SwingAnim:Stop() end if SwingSound then SwingSound:Stop() end
if screenGui then screenGui.Parent = nil end end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

math.randomseed(tick())
-- First make some standard variable declarations and checks local Tool = script.Parent local myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then script:Remove() end local myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") local Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if myHumanoid and Torso then
LookVector = Torso.CFrame.lookVector.unit
local Baseball = Instance.new("Part") Baseball.Name = "Baseball" Baseball.formFactor = 3 --Custom Baseball.Size = Vector3.new(0.3, 0.3, 0.3) Baseball.Locked = true Baseball.Material = "Grass" Baseball.RotVelocity = Vector3.new(math.random(), math.random(), math.random()) Baseball.Position = Torso.Position + 2 * LookVector + Vector3.new(LookVector.Z, 0, -LookVector.X) Baseball.Parent = game.Workspace

local Tool = script.Parent local Bat = Tool.Handle
local myCharacter local myHumanoid local Torso
local isBaseballisticObj = Tool.IsBaseballistic -- We know isBaseballisticObj ~= nil because we checked for that before enabling this script. local startPoint local targetPoint local targetDir local targetRay local partToAttack
local debris = game:service("Debris")
local baseballsRemaining
local resetBaseballNumScript
local Baseball = Instance.new("Part") Baseball.Name = "Baseball" Baseball.Size = Vector3.new(20, 20, 20) Baseball.Shape = Enum.PartType.Ball Baseball.Material = "Grass" Baseball.Locked = true
local BaseballMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") BaseballMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=55021861" BaseballMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=55021914" BaseballMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(85, 85, 85) BaseballMesh.Parent = Baseball
local RedSparkles = Instance.new("Sparkles") RedSparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(1, 0, 0) local WhiteSparkles = Instance.new("Sparkles") WhiteSparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(1, 1, 1)
if Bat then RedSparkles.Parent = Bat WhiteSparkles.Parent = Bat end
function onActivated() -- Standard checks, plus checking to make sure that the user's turned on baseballisticism. Yeah, that's a word now. myCharacter = Tool.Parent if not myCharacter then return end myHumanoid = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") Torso = myCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") if not (myHumanoid and Torso) then return end if not isBaseballisticObj.Value then return end baseballsRemaining = Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballsRemaining") if not baseballsRemaining then return end isBaseballisticObj.Value = false -- To make sure you can't click multiple times for multiple baseballs
--Use a ray trace to find the part we want to attack. startPoint = Torso.Position targetPoint = myHumanoid.TargetPoint targetDir = (targetPoint - startPoint).unit print (targetDir) targetRay = Ray.new(startPoint, 500*targetDir) partToAttack, intersectionPoint = game.Workspace:FindPartOnRay(targetRay, myCharacter)
if partToAttack ~= nil then -- Spawn a giant baseball above this part local GiantBall = Baseball:Clone() GiantBall.Position = partToAttack.Position + Vector3.new(0, 50, 0) GiantBall.Name = "Giant Baseball" GiantBall.Parent = game.Workspace debris:AddItem(GiantBall, 15) partToAttack = nil -- To reset for the next time. -- Remove sparkles :( RedSparkles.Parent = nil WhiteSparkles.Parent = nil -- Set the number of balls remaining up to change baseballsRemaining.Value = baseballsRemaining.Value - 1 -- Set everything else back to normal. wait() -- Wait necessary to avoid triggering BaseballBat LS's onActivated event. -- However, this only matters in Play Solo; when playing on a server, the delay time between -- local and server scripts provides enough of a wait. Tool.Enabled = true -- And, after a while, remove the script. wait(15) script:Remove() else isBaseballisticObj.Value = true -- So that if we accidentally don't click on something, we can try again. end
end
function onUnequipped() RedSparkles.Parent = nil WhiteSparkles.Parent = nil Tool.Enabled = true isBaseballisticObj.Value = false script:Remove() end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

local Tool = script.Parent
local baseballsRemaining
function resetBaseballNumber(child) if (child.Name == "Giant Baseball") then baseballsRemaining = Tool:FindFirstChild("BaseballsRemaining") if not baseballsRemaining then return end baseballsRemaining.Value = baseballsRemaining.Value + 1 end end
game.Workspace.ChildRemoved:connect(resetBaseballNumber)
